N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7930.5 - Listing of radon assessment specialists

State Regulations
(a) SEO shall publish a list of individuals
who have filed a complete application and who meet the requirements set forth
in section
7930.3
of this Part. (b) To remain on the list, an RAS shall be
required to respond to an annual survey concerning services he or she
offers. (c) The list of RASs shall
be reviewed and updated by SEO on a quarterly basis. (d) SEO may remove a name from the list of
RASs for reasons including, but not limited to, materially misstating
information regarding the requirements listed in section
7930.3
of this Part, failure to
follow Radon Contractor Proficiency Program Radon Mitigation Guidelines as set
forth by the EPA [FN1], failure to maintain EPA's Radon Contractor Proficiency

Listing, or failure to respond to the Annual Survey required by subdivision (b)
of this section. (e) Inclusion on
SEO's list does not guarantee participation in the Radon Diagnosis Assistance

Program. The Department of Health shall exercise oversight over the program and
may decline to contract with RASs who do not meet their program guidelines or
who fail to provide services in a workmanlike manner. (f) In order to be selected to provide
services under this program, an RAS must be on SEO's most current RAS list and
under contract to the Department of Health for the purposes of this program. [FN1] A copy of the Radon Contractor Proficiency Program

Radon Mitigation Guidelines, dated October, 1989, may be obtained from the
publisher at the following address: United States Environmental Protection

Agency (ANR 464), Attention: Radon Contractor Proficiency Program Manager, 401
M Street, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20460. The guidelines are available for public
inspection and copying at the following location: New York State Energy Office, Counsel's Office, 9th floor, 2 Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY
12223. Notes
